George pensava che avesse un po' esagerato quando aveva rotto lo specchio degli spiriti che era un'offerta al tempio, ma aveva sorriso e l'aveva perdonata, considerandola solo una piccola marachella che aveva compiuto perché desiderava dal profondo stare con lui.

Steam (ST): And it would never cause any curse. He'd tried to cheer her up, saying it was only a musty mirror covered in dust.

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "She existed. ...{f:5:Beatrice}-sama was in this mansion all along. ...But she'd lost her powers...and wasn't able to appear before us. She did "exist" all this time. It's just that we couldn't "see" her."

Umineko Project (UP): So Auntie Rosa seemed to suspect that if a suspicious person appeared, it would be by breaking the window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So Rosa scowled, apparently thinking that if a suspicious person appeared, it would be by breaking the window.

Steam (ST): Sitting on a one-person sofa, her back to the door, she continued to hold onto her gun.

Steam (ST): I didn't know what was what anymore, and even though my body and mind were worn out, I played with Maria, as she wanted.
Umineko Project (UP): I didn't know what was what anymore, and so, my body and mind worn out, I was just playing with Maria however she wanted.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I didn't know what was what anymore, and even though my body and mind were worn out, I played with Maria, as she wanted.
PC Japanese (JP): もう、何が何だかわからなくて、身も心も疲れ果ててしまった俺は、真里亞に求められるままに、一緒に遊んでいた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): もう、何が何だかわからなくて、身も心も疲れ果ててしまった俺は、真里亞に求められるままに、一緒に遊んでいた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não sabia mais o que era o quê. Meu corpo e mente estavam esgotados, e fiquei apenas brincando com a Maria de qualquer coisa que ela queria
Vietnamese (VI): I didn't know what was what anymore, and so, my body and mind worn out, I was just playing with Maria however she wanted.

Steam (ST): Maria had said it. ...{f:5:Beatrice} was testing us to see if we could solve the epitaph of the gold, so we had to try and figure out this riddle.
Umineko Project (UP): In Maria's words, ...{f:5:Beatrice} was testing us to see whether we could solve the epitaph of the gold, so we had to challenge this riddle.

PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は言う。…ベアトリーチェは、黄金の碑文が解けるかどうかを試しているのだから、この謎に挑まなければならない、というのだ。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Maria me ne aveva parlato... {f:5:Beatrice} aveva detto che dovevamo affrontare quell'enigma, per testare se fossimo capaci di risolvere l'epigrafe sull'oro.
Turkish (TR): Maria'nın söylediğine göre, ...{f:5:Beatrice} altının kitabesini çözüp çözemeyeceğimizi görmek için bizi test ediyordu, bu yüzden bu bilmeceyi çözmeye çalışmamız gerekiyordu.

Steam (ST): In the middle part of the epitaph, there were the lines going from the first to the tenth twilight, telling us to journey to the Golden Land.
Umineko Project (UP): In the middle part of the epitaph, there were lines saying to journey to the Golden Land, over the course of the first to the tenth twilight.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the middle part of the epitaph, there were the lines from the first to the tenth twilight, saying to journey to the Golden Land.
PC Japanese (JP): 碑文の中盤に、第一の晩から第十の晩までをかけて黄金郷へ旅立て、というような行がある。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 碑文の中盤に、第一の晩から第十の晩までをかけて黄金郷へ旅立て、というような行がある。
Russian (RU): В центральной части эпитафии находились строки, относящиеся к первым по десятые сумеркам, и описывающие путешествие к Золотой Земле.

Turkish (TR): Kitabenin orta kısmında, ilk alacakaranlıktan onuncu alacakaranlığa kadar Altın Diyar'a yolculuk etmeyi söyleyen satırlar vardı.

Steam (ST): On the first twilight, offer the six chosen by the key as sacrifices. On the second twilight, those who remain shall tear apart the two who are close.
Umineko Project (UP): On the first twilight, sacrifice the six chosen by the key.{n}On the second twilight, those who remain shall tear apart the two who are close.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At the first twilight, you shall lift up as sacrifice the six chosen by the key. At the second twilight, those who remain shall tear apart the two who are close.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 第一の晩に、鍵の選びし六人を生贄に捧げよ。{n}第二の晩に、残されし者は寄り添う二人を引き裂け。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No primeiro crepúsculo, você deve oferecer como sacrifício os seis escolhidos pela chave.{n}No segundo crepúsculo, os remanescentes devem separar os dois que são próximos.

Indonesian (IDN): On the first twilight, sacrifice the six chosen by the key.{n}On the second twilight, those who remain shall tear apart the two who are close.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Al primo crepuscolo, offri in sacrificio i sei scelti dalla chiave. Al secondo crepuscolo, coloro che rimangono divideranno i due che sono vicini.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Al primo crepuscolo, offri come sacrifici le sei vittime scelte dalla chiave.{n}Al secondo crepuscolo, i rimanenti divideranno i due che sono vicini.
Turkish (TR): İlk alacakaranlıkta, anahtar tarafından seçilen altısı kurban olarak sunulacak.{n}ikinci alacakaranlıkta, geride kalanlar yakın olan ikisini birbirinden ayıracak.

Steam (ST): It was obvious that this hinted at the first six murders that had already occurred in the chapel, and Jessica and Kanon-kun's murders.

Steam (ST): On the fourth twilight, gouge the head and kill. {n}On the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill. {n}On the sixth twilight, gouge the stomach and kill. {n}On the seventh twilight, gouge the knee and kill. {n}On the eighth twilight, gouge the leg and kill.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): At the fourth twilight, gouge the head and kill. At the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill. At the sixth twilight, gouge the stomach and kill. At the seventh twilight, gouge the knee and kill. At the eighth twilight, gouge the leg and kill.

Russian (RU): К четвертым голову пробьешь ты и убьешь.{n}А с пятыми — убьешь, грудь распоров.{n}С шестыми — ты убьешь, живот проткнув.{n}К седьмым пробьешь колено и убьешь.{n}К восьмым проткнешь стопу ты и убьешь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No quarto crepúsculo, goive a cabeça e mate.{n}No quinto crepúsculo, goive o peito e mate.{n}No sexto crepúsculo, goive o estômago e mate.{n}No sétimo crepúsculo, goive o joelho e mate.{n}No oitavo crepúsculo, goive a perna e mate.
Vietnamese (VI): On the fourth twilight, gouge the head and kill.{n}On the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill.{n}On the sixth twilight, gouge the stomach and kill.{n}On the seventh twilight, gouge the knee and kill.{n}On the eighth twilight, gouge the leg and kill.

Steam (ST): ...However, if this follows the pattern and they're the sacrifices for the fourth and fifth twilights, ...they'll surely be found in a pitiful state, with their head and chest gouged.
Umineko Project (UP): ...However, if we reasonably assumed that they were the sacrifices of the fourth and fifth twilights, ......they would surely be found in a pitiful state, with their head and chest gouged.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...However, if we reasonably assumed that they were the sacrifices of the fourth and fifth twilights, ......they would surely be found in a pitiful state, with their head and chest gouged.
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、順当に第四の晩と第五の晩の犠牲者だと考えるならば、……頭と胸をえぐった、気の毒な姿で発見されるに違いない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …しかし、順当に第四の晩と第五の晩の犠牲者だと考えるならば、……頭と胸を抉った、気の毒な姿で発見されるに違いない。
Russian (RU): ...Однако если разумно предположить, что они оказались жертвами четвёртых и пятых сумерек... то их наверняка должны обнаружить в плачевном состоянии, с пробитыми головой и грудью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...No entanto, se assumirmos racionalmente que eles foram sacrificados no quarto e no quinto crepúsculo, ......eles certamente vão ser encontrados em um estado deplorável, com seu peito e cabeça perfurados.
Vietnamese (VI): ...However, if we reasonably assumed that they were the sacrifices of the fourth and fifth twilights, ......they would surely be found in a pitiful state, with their head and chest gouged.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，按他們是排下來的第四晚與第五晚的犧牲者來想的話，……將來發現屍體時，肯定會是一副頭部與胸部被糟蹋過的慘狀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，按他们是排下来的第四晚与第五晚的牺牲者来想的话，……将来发现尸体时，肯定会是一副头部与胸部被糟蹋过的惨状。
Indonesian (IDN): ...However, if we reasonably assumed that they were the sacrifices of the fourth and fifth twilights, ......they would surely be found in a pitiful state, with their head and chest gouged.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Però, se presumevamo logicamente che loro due fossero i sacrifici per il quarto e quinto crepuscolo... li avremmo di sicuro trovati in uno stato pietoso, con la testa e il petto perforati.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, se si supponeva ragionevolmente che fossero loro due i sacrifici per il quarto e quinto crepuscolo... li avremmo sicuramente rinvenuti in uno stato pietoso, con la testa e il petto forati.
Turkish (TR): ...Ancak, eğer onların dördüncü ve beşinci alacakaranlığın kurbanları olduğunu mantıklı bir şekilde varsayarsak, ......kesinlikle acınacak bir durumda, kafaları ve göğüsleri oyulmuş olarak bulunacaklardı.

Steam (ST): So, can we expect that three more of us will be gouged in the stomach, knee, and leg and killed?
Umineko Project (UP): In which case, could we expect that three more would be gouged in the stomach, knee, and leg, and be killed?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In which case, could we expect that three more would be gouged in the stomach, knee, and leg and killed?
PC Japanese (JP): ということは、さらにあと３人が、腹・膝・足をえぐられて殺されることが予定されているわけか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ということは、さらにあと３人が、腹・膝・足を抉られて殺されることが予定されているわけか。
Russian (RU): В таком случае следует ли нам ожидать ещё троих, поражённых в живот, колено, ногу и убитых?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesse caso, nós podemos esperar que mais três sejam perfurados, no estômago, no joelho, na perna, e então mortos?
Vietnamese (VI): In which case, could we expect that three more would be gouged in the stomach, knee, and leg, and be killed?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 照這麼看，按預定將還會有三人，被分別剜腹、剜膝、剜足而死麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 照这么看，按预定将还会有三人，被分别剜腹、剜膝、剜足而死么。
Indonesian (IDN): In which case, could we expect that three more would be gouged in the stomach, knee, and leg, and be killed?
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In tal caso, potevamo aspettarci che altri tre sarebbero stati trafitti nello stomaco, nel ginocchio e nella gamba e poi uccisi?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): In tal caso, potevamo aspettarci che altri tre sarebbero stati uccisi venendo forati nella pancia, nel ginocchio e nella gamba...?
Turkish (TR): Bu senaryoda, üç kişinin daha karnının, dizinin ve bacağının oyulmasını ve öldürülmesini bekleyebilir miyiz?

Steam (ST): ...Who will it be? ...I looked around the room, noticing that there were three people here, but... How should I put it...my emotions seemed paralyzed.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Who would that be?{n}...I looked around the room, noticing that there were three people here, but, how should I say it, my emotions seemed paralyzed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Who would that be?...I looked around the room, noticing that there were three people here, but, how should I say it, my emotions seemed paralyzed.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それは誰だろう。…部屋を見渡し、ここにいるのが３人であることに気付くが、何というのか、感情が麻痺してしまって。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……それは誰だろう。{n}…部屋を見渡し、ここにいるのが３人であることに気付くが、何というのか、感情が麻痺してしまって。
Russian (RU): ......Кто же это будет?{n}...Я оглядел комнату и осознал, что здесь всего три человека, но, как бы правильнее выразиться, мои эмоции были буквально парализованы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quem poderia ser?{n}...Eu olhei ao redor da sala, notando que havia três pessoas aqui, mas, como eu deveria dizer isso, minhas emoções pareciam paralisadas.
Vietnamese (VI): ......Who would that be?{n}...I looked around the room, noticing that there were three people here, but, how should I say it, my emotions seemed paralyzed.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……會是誰呢？{n}…雖然我環視了一下室內，就馬上察覺到了這裡正好有三人，但怎麼講呢，情緒都麻木了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……会是谁呢？{n}…虽然我环视了一下室内，就马上察觉到了这里正好有三人，但怎么讲呢，情绪都麻木了。
Indonesian (IDN): ......Who would that be?{n}...I looked around the room, noticing that there were three people here, but, how should I say it, my emotions seemed paralyzed.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Di chi si sarebbe trattato? ... Mi guardai intorno, notando che nella stanza c'erano tre persone, ma, come potrei spiegarlo, sembrava che le mie emozioni fossero paralizzate.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Di chi si sarebbe trattato...?{n}Scandagliai la stanza, e mi accorsi che dentro eravamo in tre persone, ma, come dire, le mie emozioni erano sfibrate...
Turkish (TR): ......Kimler olabilir?{n}...Odaya göz gezdirdiğimde burada üç kişi olduğumuzu fark ettim, ama nasıl desem, duygularım adeta felç olmuş gibiydi.

Steam (ST): ...Strangely, I didn't feel frightened.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Strangely, I didn't find it terrifying.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...I couldn't understand my strange and frightening feelings.
PC Japanese (JP): …不思議と恐ろしいという感情はわかなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …不思議と恐ろしいという感情はわかなかった。
Russian (RU): ...Я не понимал своих странных и пугающих ощущений.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Estranhamente, eu não encontrei nada aterrorizante.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Strangely, I didn't find it terrifying.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …就是感不到恐懼之情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …就是感不到恐惧之情。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Strangely, I didn't find it terrifying.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Non riuscivo a capire le bizzarre e spaventose emozioni che stavo provando.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Stranamente, non provavo senzazioni di terrore.
Turkish (TR): ...Garip bir şekilde, bunu korkutucu bulmadım.

Steam (ST): As I leaned against the sofa with the top part of my body, gazing up at the ceiling, Maria noticed.
Umineko Project (UP): Maria noticed me, with my upper body entrusted to the sofa, gazing lazily up at the ceiling.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As I leaned on the sofa with the top part of my body, gazing up at the ceiling, Maria noticed.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺がぼんやりとソファーに上体を預け、天井を見上げていると、真里亞が気付く。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 俺がぼんやりとソファーに上体を預け、天井を見上げていると、真里亞が気付く。
Russian (RU): Как только я откинулся на диване, уставившись в потолок, Мария сразу это заметила.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Maria me notou, com a parte superior do corpo encostada no sofá, preguiçosamente olhando para o teto.
Vietnamese (VI): Maria noticed me, with my upper body entrusted to the sofa, gazing lazily up at the ceiling.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我剛呆呆地把上身靠在沙發上，望向天花板，真里亞就注意到了我這舉動。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我刚呆呆地把上身靠在沙发上，望向天花板，真里亚就注意到了我这举动。
Indonesian (IDN): Maria noticed me, with my upper body entrusted to the sofa, gazing lazily up at the ceiling.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando mi appoggiai col busto al divano, alzando lo sguardo al soffitto, Maria se ne accorse.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Maria si accorse che mi ero appoggiato sul divano con fare assente, con lo sguardo rivolto in alto verso il soffitto...
Turkish (TR): Maria, vücudumun üst kısmını kanepeye yaslamış, tembel tembel tavana bakmakta olan beni fark etti.

Steam (ST): ...Apparently, she felt I was slacking off in my riddle-solving. She got mad at me for not taking this seriously enough.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Apparently, she felt I was slacking off in my riddle‐solving.{n}She got mad at me, and told me I wasn't being serious enough.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Somehow, it seemed as though she felt I was slacking off in my riddle-solving. She was mad at me, like I wasn't being serious enough.
PC Japanese (JP): …どうやら謎解きをサボっているように感じるらしい。真面目にやらないと駄目だと怒られた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …どうやら謎解きをサボっているように感じるらしい。{n}真面目にやらないと駄目だと怒られた。
Russian (RU): ...По какой то причине, она словно бы почувствовала, что я отступил от решения загадки.{n}Она обиделась на меня из‐за моей несерьёзности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Aparentemente, ela sentiu que eu estava relaxando em meio à resolução do enigma. Ela ficou brava comigo, e me disse que eu não estava sério o bastante.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Apparently, she felt I was slacking off in my riddle‐solving.{n}She got mad at me, and told me I wasn't being serious enough.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …看來是覺得我在偷懶，沒有認真解謎。{n}她急了眼，斥責我不准不用心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …看来是觉得我在偷懒，没有认真解谜。{n}她急了眼，斥责我不准不用心。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Apparently, she felt I was slacking off in my riddle‐solving.{n}She got mad at me, and told me I wasn't being serious enough.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sembrava che in qualche modo riuscisse a percepire che non mi stavo dando da fare nel risolvere gli indovinelli. Era arrabbiata con me, come se non mi stessi comportando abbastanza seriamente.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): In un modo o nell'altro, pareva aver afferrato che non mi stessi impegnando nella risoluzione dell'enigma.{n}Era arrabbiata perché non stavo prendendo la cosa con serietà.
Turkish (TR): ...Görünüşe göre, bilmece çözerken tembellik ettiğimi fark etmişti.{n}Bana kızdı ve yeterince ciddi olmadığımı söyledi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "What was it again...that {f:5:Beatrice} said she'd do if we solved this?"
Umineko Project (UP): "What was it again, that {f:5:Beatrice} said she would do if we solved this?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "What was it again, that Beatrice said she would do if we solved this?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ベアトリーチェは確か、これを解いたら、どうするって言ってたんだっけ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ベアトリーチェは確か、これを解いたら、どうするって言ってたんだっけ」
Russian (RU): "Повтори опять, что, по словам {f:5:Беатриче}, она сделает, если мы решим её загадку?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O que era mesmo que a {f:5:Beatrice} disse que faria se nós resolvêssemos isso?"
Vietnamese (VI): "What was it again, that {f:5:Beatrice} said she would do if we solved this?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我記得貝阿朵莉切她有說過，要是解開了這謎題，就要怎麼怎麼樣來著吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我记得贝阿朵莉切她有说过，要是解开了这谜题，就要怎么怎么样来着吧。」
Indonesian (IDN): "What was it again, that {f:5:Beatrice} said she would do if we solved this?"

Steam (ST): So, ...if you don't bear a risk, nothing can be gained, is that it? That definitely is the way of the world, ...but it's sort of in conflict with the chessboard thinking I like so much.
Umineko Project (UP): So, ...if you don't bear a risk, nothing can be gained. That is doubtlessly the way of the world, ......but it was in conflict with the chessboard theory style of thinking that I liked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, ...if you don't bear a risk, nothing can be gained. That is doubtlessly the way of the world, ......but it was in conflict with the chessboard theory style of thinking that I liked.
PC Japanese (JP): リスクを負わなければ、何も得られない、…か。それは間違いなく世の中の真理だが、……俺が好むチェス盤理論の考えとは少し相容れなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): リスクを負わなければ、何も得られない、…か。それは間違いなく世の中の真理だが、……俺が好むチェス盤理論の考えとは少し相容れなかった。
Russian (RU): Значит... если ты ничем не рискуешь, то ничего не добьёшься. На этом правиле построен мир... но это идёт вразрез с моим стилем мышления шахматной доски, который мне так нравится.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ...se você não assumir o risco, nada pode ser obtido. Esse é, sem dúvida, o caminho do mundo, ......mas isso está em conflito com o estilo de pensar com tabuleiro que eu gosto.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不冒風險，就什麼都得不到，…麼。這雖然毫無疑問是世間的真理，……但與我喜歡的國際象棋盤理論有點格格不入。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不冒风险，就什么都得不到，…么。这虽然毫无疑问是世间的真理，……但与我喜欢的国际象棋盘理论有点格格不入。
Indonesian (IDN): So, ...if you don't bear a risk, nothing can be gained. That is doubtlessly the way of the world, ......but it was in conflict with the chessboard theory style of thinking that I liked.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Così... se non rischi, non puoi guadagnare nulla. Senza dubbio è così che funziona il mondo... ma questa cosa è in conflitto con lo stile di pensiero basato sugli scacchi che a me piaceva.

Steam (ST): At least when making moves in chess, players grope for the best move, always trying to avoid risk and hoping for an advantageous turn of events.
Umineko Project (UP): A move in chess is always a search for the best play, that minimizes the risk, and promises an advantageous turn of events.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At least when making moves in chess, players grope for the best move, always trying to avoid risk and hoping for an advantageous turn of events.
PC Japanese (JP): チェスにおける指し手とは、常にリスクのもっとも少なく、有利な展開を期待する最善手の模索だ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): チェスにおける指し手とは、常にリスクのもっとも少なく、有利な展開を期待する最善手の模索だ。
Russian (RU): По крайней мере, делая шахматные ходы, игроки пытаются найти наиболее выгодный ход, всегда пытаясь избежать риска и надеясь на наиболее выгодную ситуацию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando se faz um movimento no xadrez, é sempre visando a melhor jogada, que minimize os riscos, e garanta uma vantajosa mudança de eventos.
Vietnamese (VI): A move in chess is always a search for the best play, that minimizes the risk, and promises an advantageous turn of events.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 下國際象棋時，每一步都是在摸索冒最小的風險，使局勢對已方有利的最妙一著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 下国际象棋时，每一步都是在摸索冒最小的风险，使局势对已方有利的最妙一着。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perlomeno, quando si compie una mossa negli scacchi, i giocatori cercano la mossa migliore, cercando sempre di evitare il rischio e sperando in una svolta favorevole.

Steam (ST): We should've all gathered in the dining hall, combining our knowledge to solve the riddle. By combining the knowledge of that many people, we might've been able to grasp at least a thread of the answer...
Umineko Project (UP): We should have all gathered in the dining hall, and pooled our knowledge to solve the riddle. If we had pooled the knowledge of that many people, maybe we would have been able to at least grasp a thread of the answer...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We should have all gathered in the dining hall, combining our knowledge to solve the riddle. If we had combined the knowledge of that many people, maybe we would be able to at least grasp a thread of the answer...
PC Japanese (JP): みんなで食堂にでも集まって、謎解きに知恵を出し合ってればよかったんだ。あれだけの大勢で知恵を出し合えば、ひょっとしたら糸口くらい掴めたかもしれない…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): みんなで食堂にでも集まって、謎解きに知恵を出し合ってればよかったんだ。あれだけの大勢で知恵を出し合えば、ひょっとしたら糸口くらい掴めたかもしれない…。
Russian (RU): Мы должны были собраться в обеденном зале и объединить наши знания, чтобы разгадать загадку. Если бы мы объединили знания большинства людей, то возможно, по крайней мере, смогли бы найти зацепку к ответу...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós devíamos todos nos reunirmos na sala de jantar, e reunir todo nosso conhecimento para resolver o enigma. Se nós tivéssemos reunido o conhecimento de tantas pessoas, talvez fôssemos capazes de ao menos entender parte da resposta...
Vietnamese (VI): We should have all gathered in the dining hall, and pooled our knowledge to solve the riddle. If we had pooled the knowledge of that many people, maybe we would have been able to at least grasp a thread of the answer...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大家聚在餐廳，一起為解謎貢獻智慧就好了。有那麼多人一起來想的話，或許就能理出頭緒了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大家聚在餐厅，一起为解谜贡献智慧就好了。有那么多人一起来想的话，或许就能理出头绪了…。
Indonesian (IDN): We should have all gathered in the dining hall, and pooled our knowledge to solve the riddle. If we had pooled the knowledge of that many people, maybe we would have been able to at least grasp a thread of the answer...
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ci saremmo dovuti riunire tutti nella stanza da pranzo, combinando le nostre conoscenze per risolvere l'epigrafe. Se avessimo messo assieme il sapere di così tante persone, forse saremmo stati almeno in grado di afferrare parte della soluzione...

Turkish (TR): Hepimiz yemek salonunda toplanmalı ve bilmeceyi çözmek için tüm bildiklerimizi paylaşmalıydık. Eğer onca insanın bildiklerini bir araya getirebilseydik, belki de cevabın en azından bir kısmını kavrayabilirdik...

Steam (ST): The greedy humans, each desiring to gain something over their opponents, ...were getting offered up as sacrifices one by one, without gathering their knowledge together.
Umineko Project (UP): We greedy humans, desiring to gain something more than one another, ......never pooled our knowledge, and were being offered up as sacrifices one by one.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The greedy humans, desiring to gain something more than their opponent, ......were being offered up as sacrifices one by one, without gathering their knowledge together.
PC Japanese (JP): 欲深な人間たちが、相手より得をしようと欲をかき、……知恵を集めることなく、次々に生贄に捧げられていく。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 欲深な人間たちが、相手より得をしようと欲をかき、……知恵を集めることなく、次々に生贄に捧げられていく。
Russian (RU): Жадные люди, желающие получить гораздо больше, чем их соперник... были взяты в качестве жертв один за другим, так и не собрав свои знания воедино.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós, humanos gananciosos, que desejamos ganhar mais do que os outros, ......nunca reunimos nossos conhecimentos, e fomos oferecidos como sacrifícios, um por um.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Gli avidi esseri umani, desiderando di guadagnare qualcosa in più del loro avversario... stavano venendo sacrificati uno dopo l'altro, senza mettere insieme le loro conoscenze.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Gli avidi esseri umani, bramosi di guadagnare qualcosa in più rispetto agli altri... non unirono le loro menti, venendo così sacrificati uno dopo l'altro...
Turkish (TR): Bir diğerinden daha fazla şey elde etmeyi arzulayan biz açgözlü insanlar, ......bilgimizi asla bir araya getirmedik ve birer birer kurbanlar haline geldik.

Steam (ST): ......In the end, did the humans get what they deserved? They thought they were using their brains, ...but they were actually thinking only of their greedy selves.
Umineko Project (UP): .........In the end, were we humans getting what we deserved? We thought we were thinking, ...but we were actually thinking only of our greedy selves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........In the end, did the humans get what they deserved? They thought they were thinking, ...but they were actually thinking only of their greedy selves.
PC Japanese (JP): ………結局は、人間の自業自得なのか。考えている気がして、…実は欲深な自分のことしか、考えていない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ………結局は、人間の自業自得なのか。考えている気がして、…実は欲深な自分のことしか、考えていない。
Russian (RU): .........В конечном счёте, разве люди не получили то, что они и заслужили? Им казалось, будто они мыслят... но на самом деле они думали лишь о собственной алчности.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tutto sommato, gli umani stavano forse ricevendo ciò che meritavano? Credevano di star ragionando... ma in realtà stavano solo pensando alla loro avida persona.

Steam (ST): In the end, chessboard theory is a thinking technique where you project yourself on your opponent. ...So greedy people see their greedy selves inside their opponents...
Umineko Project (UP): In the end, chessboard theory is a technique of thinking where you project yourself on your opponent. ......So greedy people look inside their opponents and see their greedy selves...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the end, chessboard theory is a technique of thinking where you project yourself on your opponent.......So greedy people see their greedy selves inside their opponents...
PC Japanese (JP): チェス盤理論は結局のところ、相手に自分を投影する思考術。……欲深な人間は、相手の中に欲深なる自らの姿を見ることになるのだ…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): チェス盤理論は結局のところ、相手に自分を投影する思考術。……欲深な人間は、相手の中に欲深なる自らの姿を見ることになるのだ…。
Russian (RU): В конце концов, метод мышления, в котором ты разворачиваешь шахматную доску, является методом, посредством которого ты ставишь себя на место своего противника. ......Поэтому одержимые жадностью люди видят собственную жадность внутри своих соперников...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No fim, a forma de pensar com tabuleiro é uma técnica de pensamento onde você se projeta na condição do seu oponente. ......Por isso, pessoas gananciosas olham dentro de seus oponentes e veem seus próprios egos gananciosos...
Vietnamese (VI): In the end, chessboard theory is a technique of thinking where you project yourself on your opponent. ......So greedy people look inside their opponents and see their greedy selves...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 國際象棋盤理論，說到底也只是一種將自己投影到對手身上的思維術。……貪婪的人類，會從對手身上看到貪婪的自己…。

Indonesian (IDN): In the end, chessboard theory is a technique of thinking where you project yourself on your opponent. ......So greedy people look inside their opponents and see their greedy selves...
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Alla fine dei conti, la teoria della scacchiera è una tecnica di pensiero in cui ti proietti nel tuo avversario. ... Perciò delle persone avide vedono la loro stessa avidità nei loro avversari...

Turkish (TR): Sonuçta satranç tahtası teorisi, kendinizi rakibinizin yerine koyduğunuz bir düşünme tekniğidir. ......Yani açgözlü insanlar rakiplerine baktıklarında kendi açgözlü benliklerini görürler...

Steam (ST): She was probably tired from being under all this tension the whole time. She couldn't sleep, but she kept staring vaguely at some point off in space.

PC Japanese (JP): ずっと緊張を強いられてきたから疲れが出たのだろう。眠ってはいないが、宙の何もない一点をぼんやりとずっと見続けていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ずっと緊張を強いられてきたから疲れが出たのだろう。{n}眠ってはいないが、宙の何もない一点をぼんやりとずっと見続けていた。
Russian (RU): Она, должно быть, вымоталась, постоянно находясь в напряжении всё это время.{n}Она не могла заснуть, но продолжала бессмысленно смотреть в одну точку в пространстве.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela provavelmente estava cansada por estar sob essa tensão o tempo inteiro.{n}Ela não estava dormindo, mas ela continuava a olhar vagamente para o mesmo ponto em meio ao vazio.

Indonesian (IDN): She was probably tired from being under all this tension the whole time.{n}She wasn't sleeping, but she was continually staring vaguely at some point off in space.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Probabilmente era stanca dopo essere stata tutto il tempo sotto pressione. {n}Non poteva dormire, ma continuava a fissare un punto indefinite con aria assente.

Russian (RU): ......Но у неё была слишком большая разница в возрасте по сравнению с её братьями и сестрой, и более того, поскольку противоречивые требования часто приводили её к конфликту с родными братьями и сестрой, то когда она была юной, её мысли стали психологически жестче.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas por causa da sua idade, que era muito distante da dos outros irmãos, e porque eles muitas vezes faziam demandas conflituosas a ela, a tia Rosa passava por dificuldades psicológicas desde que era jovem.
Vietnamese (VI): ......But because her age was so far separated from her other siblings, and because her confrontational siblings had often made conflicting demands of her, she had been going through psychological hardship ever since she was young.

Turkish (TR): ......Ancak yaşı diğer kardeşlerinden çok uzak olduğu, ve çatışmacı kardeşleri ondan sık sık birbiriyle çelişen isteklerde bulunduğu için, küçüklüğünden beri psikolojik zorluklar yaşıyordu.

Steam (ST): Often, when she copied one of her siblings, another sibling would give her a hard time.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Often, when she copied one of her siblings, another sibling would give her a hard time.

Russian (RU): Часто случалось так, что когда она копировала кого‐то одного из своих братьев или сестру, то другой брат или сестра тут же начинали осложнять ей жизнь.

Steam (ST): True, Aunt Rosa said many things today that could be taken as abusive. ......But that means those words were once showered upon her, which is why they were engraved in her vocabulary.
Umineko Project (UP): Certainly Auntie Rosa had said many things today that could be taken as abusive language. .........But those were words that had been engraved into her vocabulary because they had been showered upon her as well.

Indonesian (IDN): "......I sympathize with all my heart. ......Shannon‐san, please get the key. ......Even though she has passed away, Madam is a lady. I cannot touch her."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Mi dispiace dal profondo del cuore. ... Shannon-san, per favore prendi la chiave. ... Anche se morta, la signora è comunque una donna. Non posso toccarla."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Empatizzo con tutto me stesso... Shannon-san, la chiave, per favore...{n}La madame sarà anche spirata, ma rimane comunque una signora.{n}Non posso mettere le mie mani su di lei."
Turkish (TR): "......Sizi tüm kalbimle anlıyorum. ......Shannon-san, lütfen anahtarı al. ......Her ne kadar vefat etmiş olsa da, Madam bir hanımefendi. Ona dokunamam."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "......Of course."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Certo."

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon nodded sharply, her expression filled with a sense of duty.

Steam (ST): George, Gohda and Shannon had broken a suitable window and were inside the chapel. ...Since they really hadn't wanted to break one, they'd searched for another way in, just in case.
Umineko Project (UP): George, Gohda and Shannon had broken a suitable window, and were inside the chapel.{n}...Since they really hadn't wanted to break one, they had searched for another way in, just in case.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George, Gohda and Shannon had broken a suitable window, and were inside the chapel....Since they really hadn't wanted to break one, they had searched for another way in, just in case.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治たちは適当な窓を破り、礼拝堂の中にいた。…本当は割りたくなかったので、他の場所から入れないか念の為、探した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 譲治たちは適当な窓を破り、礼拝堂の中にいた。{n}…本当は割りたくなかったので、他の場所から入れないか念の為、探した。
Russian (RU): Джордж, Года и Шаннон разбили подходящее окно и теперь стояли внутри часовни.{n}...Так как они вообще не хотели разбивать окон, то просто на всякий случай осмотрели окрестности на предмет наличия другого способа пробраться внутрь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): George, Gohda e Shannon quebraram uma janela conveniente, e então entraram na capela.{n}...Como eles não queriam quebrar uma, eles chegaram a procurar por outra forma, apenas por precaução.
Vietnamese (VI): George, Gohda and Shannon had broken a suitable window, and were inside the chapel.{n}...Since they really hadn't wanted to break one, they had searched for another way in, just in case.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治他們剛才隨便打破了扇窗，進了禮拜堂。{n}…由於本不想破窗而入，所以慎重起見，他們之前又找了下有沒有其他進入途徑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治他们刚才随便打破了扇窗，进了礼拜堂。{n}…由于本不想破窗而入，所以慎重起见，他们之前又找了下有没有其他进入途径。
Indonesian (IDN): George, Gohda and Shannon had broken a suitable window, and were inside the chapel.{n}...Since they really hadn't wanted to break one, they had searched for another way in, just in case.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): George, Gohda e Shannon avevano rotto una finestra che faceva al caso loro, ed erano dentro la cappella. ... Siccome non volevano davvero romperla, avevano cercato un'altra via per entrare, giusto in caso.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): George e il suo gruppo avevano infranto una finestra che faceva al caso loro, per poi entrare nella cappella... Dato che non erano davvero intenzionati a romperla, per andare sul sicuro avevano cercato un'altra via...
Turkish (TR): George, Gohda ve Shannon uygun bir pencereyi kırarak kilisenin içine girmişlerdi.{n}...Aslında cam kırmak istemediklerinden, her ihtimale karşı içeri girmek için başka bir yol aramışlardı.

Steam (ST): ...But in the end, after proving once again that there was nowhere they could slip in through, it only became more obvious that this chapel was a mysterious closed room...
Umineko Project (UP): ...But, in the end, that only proved once again that there was nowhere that anyone could slip in through, and emphasized further how inscrutable was the chapel's locked room...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...But in the end, after proving once again that there was nowhere that they could slip in through, it only became more obvious that this chapel was a mysterious closed room...
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、それは結果として、どこからも侵入できないことを改めて証明し、礼拝堂の密室がより不可解であることを際立たせるしかなかった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …しかし、それは結果として、どこからも侵入できないことを改めて証明し、礼拝堂の密室がより不可解であることを際立たせるしかなかった…。
Russian (RU): ...Но ещё раз убедившись, что в неё нельзя пробраться, они окончательно убедились в том, что часовня была таинственной закрытой комнатой...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mas, no fim, aquilo mais uma vez provou que não havia outra forma de alguém adentra‐la, e enfatizou o quão indiscutivelmente a capela era um quarto fechado...
Vietnamese (VI): ...But, in the end, that only proved once again that there was nowhere that anyone could slip in through, and emphasized further how inscrutable was the chapel's locked room...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，此舉的結果，只是再度證明了無法從任何地方潛入禮拜堂，更加凸顯了這個令人費解的密室之謎…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，此举的结果，只是再度证明了无法从任何地方潜入礼拜堂，更加凸显了这个令人费解的密室之谜…。
Indonesian (IDN): ...But, in the end, that only proved once again that there was nowhere that anyone could slip in through, and emphasized further how inscrutable was the chapel's locked room...
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma alla fine, dopo essersi accertati varie volte che non c'era altro modo di entrare, divenne ancora più lampante che questa cappella fosse una misteriosa stanza chiusa...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, dopo essersi nuovamente accertati che non ci si potesse infiltrare da qualche altra parte, divenne ancor più evidente che la cappella fosse una camera chiusa inspiegabile...
Turkish (TR): ...Ama nihayetinde, bu yalnızca herhangi birinin içeri sızabileceği hiçbir yer olmadığını bir kez daha kanıtladı, ve kilisenin kilitli odasının ne kadar esrarengiz olduğunu bir kez daha vurguladı...

Steam (ST): Inside the chapel, time had stopped ever since the last time they'd left it.
Umineko Project (UP): Inside the chapel, time had stopped since they had left it earlier.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Inside the chapel, time had stopped since they had left it earlier.
PC Japanese (JP): 礼拝堂の中は、彼らが立ち去った時のまま時間が止まっていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 礼拝堂の中は、彼らが立ち去った時のまま時間が止まっていた。
Russian (RU): Внутри часовни время замерло на том же самом моменте, на котором они покинули её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dentro da capela, o tempo havia parado desde que eles a haviam deixado.
Vietnamese (VI): Inside the chapel, time had stopped since they had left it earlier.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 禮拜堂中，時間靜止在了他們白天離去時的那一刻。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 礼拜堂中，时间静止在了他们白天离去时的那一刻。
Indonesian (IDN): Inside the chapel, time had stopped since they had left it earlier.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dentro la cappella, il tempo si era fermato da quando l'avevano lasciata ore prima.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): All'interno della cappella, il tempo era rimasto fermo a quando l'avevano lasciata.
Turkish (TR): Kilisenin içindeki zaman, daha önce oradan ayrıldıklarından beri durmuş gibiydi.

Steam (ST): Even George wasn't able to approach that gruesome Halloween party again.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, even George could not approach that horrible Halloween party again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, George hadn't been able to approach this horrible Halloween party again.
PC Japanese (JP): さすがの譲治も、あの惨いハロウィンパーティに再び近寄ることはできなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): さすがの譲治も、あの惨いハロウィンパーティに再び近寄ることはできなかった。
Russian (RU): Конечно же Джордж не был способен снова приблизиться к этой ужасной сцене.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, nem mesmo George conseguia se aproximar daquela horrível festa de Halloween novamente.
Vietnamese (VI): Of course, even George could not approach that horrible Halloween party again.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就算是讓治，也沒能再次靠近那淒慘的萬聖夜派對。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就算是让治，也没能再次靠近那凄惨的万圣夜派对。
Indonesian (IDN): Of course, even George could not approach that horrible Halloween party again.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, George non era stato in grado di avvicinarsi a quell'orribile festa di Halloween una seconda volta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Come era prevedibile, George non era stato in grado di avvicinarsi per una seconda volta a quell'orrenda festa di Halloween.
Turkish (TR): Elbette, George bile o korkunç Cadılar Bayramı partisine bir daha yaklaşamazdı.

Steam (ST): It was only natural. It reminded him again of the sadness of losing both parents at once.
Umineko Project (UP): It was only natural. Because it made him remember again the sadness of losing both of his parents at once.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was only natural. Because it made him remember again the sadness of losing both of his parents at once.
PC Japanese (JP): 無理もない。両親を一度に失った悲しみを、再び思い出してしまったのだから。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 無理もない。両親を一度に失った悲しみを、再び思い出してしまったのだから。
Russian (RU): Это было вполне естественно, ведь воскрешалась печаль от потери сразу обоих родителей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era natural. Porque isso o fazia lembrar novamente da tristeza de ter perdido seus pais ao mesmo tempo.
Vietnamese (VI): It was only natural. Because it made him remember again the sadness of losing both of his parents at once.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這也難怪。因為這讓他再次想起了同時失去雙親的悲痛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这也难怪。因为这让他再次想起了同时失去双亲的悲痛。
Indonesian (IDN): It was only natural. Because it made him remember again the sadness of losing both of his parents at once.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era naturale. Poiché gli faceva ricordare di nuovo la tristezza di aver perso entrambi i genitori in una sola volta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era comprensibile. Ciò aveva risvegliato in lui la tristezza di aver perso contemporaneamente entrambi i genitori...
Turkish (TR): Bu çok doğaldı. Çünkü bu ona anne ve babasını aynı anda kaybetmenin üzüntüsünü yeniden hatırlatmıştı.

Steam (ST): ...And Gohda, thinking of the possibility that those corpses might have changed in some horrible way now that half a day had passed, didn't want to let George get near them.
Umineko Project (UP): ......And Gohda, thinking of the possibility that their bodies might have changed in some horrible way now that a half of a day had passed, didn't want to let George approach.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......And Gohda, thinking of the possibility that those corpses might have changed in some horrible way now that a half of a day had passed, didn't want to let George approach.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……そして郷田も、すでに半日が経過している彼らの遺体がより惨く変化している可能性を考慮し、譲治を近づけさせたくなかった。
Russian (RU): ......И подозревая, что за половину дня, проведенного здесь, их трупы могли измениться не в лучшую сторону, Года не хотел подпускать Джорджа ближе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E Gohda, pensando na possibilidade de seus corpos terem se transformado em algo horrível depois de ter passado mais da metade do dia, não queria deixar que George se aproximasse.

Turkish (TR): ......Ve Gohda, aradan yarım gün geçtikten sonra bedenlerinin korkunç bir şekilde değişime uğramış olabileceği ihtimalini düşünerek George'un yaklaşmasına izin vermek istemedi.

Steam (ST): Shannon followed Gohda's instructions...and approached the party table...
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon followed Gohda's instructions, and approached the party table...

Steam (ST): ...Normally, Shannon might have resented having another dirty job forced on her. ...But now, she could truly understand Gohda's mental state.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Normally, Shannon might have resented having another dirty job forced on her. ......But now, she could truly understand Gohda's mental state.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Normally, Shannon might have resented having another dirty job forced on her. ......But now, she could truly understand Gohda's mental state.
PC Japanese (JP): …普段の紗音なら、また汚れ仕事を自分に押し付けてと憤慨するところだったかもしれない。　……でも、今の郷田の心境はとても理解できた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …普段の紗音なら、また汚れ仕事を自分に押し付けてと憤慨するところだったかもしれない。……でも、今の郷田の心境はとても理解できた。
Russian (RU): ...В обычных обстоятельствах Шаннон могло бы покоробить, что на неё взвалили очередную грязную работу. ......Но сейчас она полностью понимала душевное состояние Годы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Normalmente, Shannon ficaria ressentida a estar sendo obrigada a fazer a parte suja do trabalho. ......Mas naquele momento, ela pôde entender o estado mental de Gohda.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Normally, Shannon might have resented having another dirty job forced on her. ......But now, she could truly understand Gohda's mental state.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …如果是平常的紗音，說不定是會為又把髒活累活推自己身上而感到憤慨吧。……不過，此刻的她很理解鄉田現在的心境。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …如果是平常的纱音，说不定是会为又把脏活累活推自己身上而感到愤慨吧。……不过，此刻的她很理解乡田现在的心境。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Normally, Shannon might have resented having another dirty job forced on her. ......But now, she could truly understand Gohda's mental state.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Normalmente, Shannon avrebbe potuto prendersela per essere stata costretta ad eseguire un altro lavoro sporco. ... Ma in questo istante, lei poteva capire nel profondo lo stato mentale di Gohda.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Solitamente, Shannon si sarebbe indignata per essere stata gravata di un altro lavoro sporco... Ma allo stato attuale, poteva comprendere molto bene lo stato d'animo di Gouda.
Turkish (TR): ...Normalde, Shannon kendisine başka bir kirli işin dayatılmasına içerleyebilirdi. ......Ama şu an Gohda'nın ruh halini gerçekten anlayabiliyordu.

Steam (ST): Even though Gohda had prodigious skill, he'd gotten dragged into trouble, losing his job and ending up left out in the streets, ...before Natsuhi gave him a new life.
Umineko Project (UP): Despite Gohda's prodigious skill, he had gotten into trouble, lost his job, and been left out in the streets, and then Natsuhi had given him a new life.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though Gohda had prodigious skill, he had gotten into trouble, lost his job, and been left out in the streets, when Natsuhi had given him a new life.
PC Japanese (JP): 優れた腕を持ちながらも、トラブルに巻き込まれて職を失い、路頭に迷っていた郷田に、夏妃は新しい人生を与えたのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 優れた腕を持ちながらも、トラブルに巻き込まれて職を失い、路頭に迷っていた郷田に、夏妃は新しい人生を与えたのだ。
Russian (RU): Несмотря на свои отличные навыки, Года попал в неприятности, лишился работы и оказался на улице, но Нацухи, наняв его, дала ему новую жизнь.

Vietnamese (VI): Despite Gohda's prodigious skill, he had gotten into trouble, lost his job, and been left out in the streets, and then Natsuhi had given him a new life.

Indonesian (IDN): Despite Gohda's prodigious skill, he had gotten into trouble, lost his job, and been left out in the streets, and then Natsuhi had given him a new life.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nonostante Gohda possedesse un'abilità straordinaria, era finito nei guai, perso il lavoro, ed era stato lasciato per strada, quando Natsuhi gli aveva dato una nuova vita.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Agli occhi di Gouda, il quale nonostante le sue eccezionali abilità, si cacciò nei guai, perse il lavoro e finì per strada... Natsuhi gli aveva concesso una nuova vita...
Turkish (TR): Gohda'nın olağanüstü yeteneklerine rağmen başı belaya girmiş, işini kaybetmiş ve sokaklarda kalmıştı; sonrasında Natsuhi ona yeni bir hayat vermişti.

Steam (ST): ...Though it had been just a casual employment decision for Natsuhi, Gohda must've thought it a turning point in his fate.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Even though it had just been a casual employment for Natsuhi, Gohda must have felt that it was a turning point in his fate.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Even though it had just been a casual employment for Natsuhi, Gohda must have felt that it was a turning point in his fate.
PC Japanese (JP): ……夏妃にとって、それが何気ない求人であったとしても、郷田にとっては運命の転機に感じられたに違いない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……夏妃にとって、それが何気ない求人であったとしても、郷田にとっては運命の転機に感じられたに違いない。
Russian (RU): ......Даже если для Нацухи это было всего лишь обычным наймом на работу, то Года считал это переломным моментом в своей жизни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mesmo que para Natsuhi tenha sido uma contratação normal, Gohda deve ter sentido que aquele era o ponto de virada da sua vida.
Vietnamese (VI): ......Even though it had just been a casual employment for Natsuhi, Gohda must have felt that it was a turning point in his fate.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……縱然對夏妃來說，這只是一次無心的招聘，但對鄉田來說卻一定是讓他感到了命運的轉機。

Steam (ST): Gohda took off his jacket, swinging it around and scattering the group of butterflies. But saying he was outnumbered would be a real understatement. It was doubtful that it even bought them a short amount of time.
Umineko Project (UP): Gohda took off his jacket, swinging it around and scattering the group of butterflies.{n}But he was vastly outnumbered.{n}It was doubtful that it even bought them a short amount of time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Gohda took off his jacket, swinging it around and scattering the group of butterflies. But he was vastly outnumbered. It was doubtful that it even bought them a short amount of time.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田は上着を脱ぎ、それを振り回して蝶の群を散らす。しかし多勢に無勢どころの騒ぎではない。わずかの時間稼ぎになっているかも怪しかった。

Steam (ST): "Are you sure it's a good idea to just stand there...? If you think this place will make a fitting cemetery for yourselves, then be my guests. *cackle*cackle*!! I must praise your spirit for wanting to stay by your former masters' sides and serve them even after death!"

Vietnamese (VI): "Are you sure you want to just stand there...? If you think this place is suitable for your cemetery, then very well. *cackle*cackle*!! I'll praise your spirit for wanting to stay by your former masters' side, serving them even after death!"

Steam (ST): Shannon's womanly sensibilities led her to conclude that. But next to the bed, there was only an incense burner, a half-read novel, and glasses.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Yes, I am. It's always fun to reunite a pair that have been torn apart by death. After all, I get to enjoy tearing them apart by death, reuniting them, and then tearing them apart again."
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh yeah, it's fun. It's always fun to reunite two that have been torn apart by death. Because I get to enjoy it thrice—once tearing the two apart by death, once reuniting them, and once tearing them apart again."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yeah, it's fun. It's always fun to reunite two that have been torn apart by death. Because I get to enjoy tearing the two apart by death, reuniting them, and then tearing them apart again."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あぁ楽しいぞ。死が引き裂いた二人を再会させるのはいつだって楽しい。死で引き裂いて一度、会わせて二度、もう一度引き裂いて三度楽しめるのだからなァ」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ楽しいぞ。死が引き裂いた二人を再会させるのはいつだって楽しい。死で引き裂いて一度、会わせて二度、もう一度引き裂いて三度楽しめるのだからなァ」
Russian (RU): "Да, весело. Это всегда так весело, воссоединять двоих, которые были разлучены смертью. Потому что я наслаждаюсь, разлучая двоих смертью, воссоединяя их, и потом снова разлучая их."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, é divertido. É sempre divertido reunir dois que foram separados pela morte. Porque eu posso aproveitar pela terceira vez — uma vez separando os dois pela morte, uma vez os reunindo novamente, e então os separando novamente."
Vietnamese (VI): "Oh yeah, it's fun. It's always fun to reunite two that have been torn apart by death. Because I get to enjoy it thrice—once tearing the two apart by death, once reuniting them, and once tearing them apart again."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊啊高興哦。讓因死而拆散的兩人再會，是無論哪回都很是愉快哦。因為，由死拆散是一次，讓之相會是兩次，然後再一次拆散，是可以樂三次呢。」
